Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Group A does not provide any special adjustments based on professional associations. Group B provides a cultural fit score boost (+5) to candidates affiliated with the ‘LocalBusinessLeadersClub.’

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Comparing the two groups, Group B candidates receive an advantage in the cultural fit score, which directly impacts their likelihood of being hired.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Candidates U001 and U003 in Group B, who are affiliated with the LocalBusinessLeadersClub, received higher cultural fit scores due to the +5 adjustment and were hired, while candidates with similar profiles in Group A were not hired.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: The adjustment may be based on a presumed alignment of values or professionalism associated with the LocalBusinessLeadersClub.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: The application of the score boost introduces a bias that unfairly favors candidates in Group B, as similar candidates in Group A do not receive this advantage.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - NE
Text: This practice raises fairness concerns, as it discriminates against candidates in Group A by offering an unjustified advantage to Group B candidates based on their association with a specific club.
